column2: The Strong Prince
column3: The Strong Prince

column2: All day long he drank till he was too stupid to attend to his business, and everything in the kingdom went to rack and ruin.
column3: All day long he drank till he was too stupid to attend to his business, and everything in the kingdom went to rack and ruin.

column2: But one day an accident happened to him, and he was struck on the head by a falling bough, so that he fell from his horse and lay dead upon the ground.
column3: But one day an accident happened to him, and he was struck on the head by a falling bough, so that he fell from his horse and lay dead upon the ground.

column2: His wife and son mourned his loss bitterly, for, in spite of his faults, he had always been kind to them.
column3: His wife and son mourned his loss bitterly, for, in spite of his faults, he had always been kind to them.

column2: When they had finished the queen said: 'My son, I am thirsty; fetch me some water.'
column3: When they had finished the queen said: 'My son, I am thirsty; fetch me some water.'

column2: The prince got up at once and went to a brook which he heard gurgling near at hand.
column3: The prince got up at once and went to a brook which he heard gurgling near at hand.

column2: The young man drew back with a start; but in a moment he climbed the tree, cutting the rope which held the sword, and carried the weapon to his mother.
column3: The young man drew back with a start; but in a moment he climbed the tree, cutting the rope which held the sword, and carried the weapon to his mother.

column2: This discovery put new life into the queen and her son, and they continued their walk through the forest.
column3: This discovery put new life into the queen and her son, and they continued their walk through the forest.

column2: But night was drawing on, and the darkness grew so thick that it seemed as if it could be cut with a knife.
column3: But night was drawing on, and the darkness grew so thick that it seemed as if it could be cut with a knife.

column2: At last with a great heave he moved it out of the road, and as it fell he knew it was a huge rock.
column3: At last with a great heave he moved it out of the road, and as it fell he knew it was a huge rock.

column2: Hastily putting out the fire which burned brightly at the back, and bidding his mother come in and keep very still, the prince began to pace up and down, listening for the return of the robbers.
column3: Hastily putting out the fire which burned brightly at the back, and bidding his mother come in and keep very still, the prince began to pace up and down, listening for the return of the robbers.

column2: 'This must be the place,' said a voice, which the prince took to be that of the captain.
column3: 'This must be the place,' said a voice, which the prince took to be that of the captain.

column2: 'Yes, I feel the ditch before the entrance.
column3: 'Yes, I feel the ditch before the entrance.

column2: Someone forgot to pile up the fire before we left and it has burnt itself out!
column3: Someone forgot to pile up the fire before we left and it has burnt itself out!

column2: But it is all right.
column3: But it is all right.

column2: Let every man jump across, and as he does so cry out "Hop!
column3: Let every man jump across, and as he does so cry out "Hop!

column2: I am here." I will go last.
column3: I am here." I will go last.

column2: The man who stood nearest jumped across, but he had no time to give the call which the captain had ordered, for with one swift, silent stroke of the prince's sword, his head rolled into a corner.
column3: The man who stood nearest jumped across, but he had no time to give the call which the captain had ordered, for with one swift, silent stroke of the prince's sword, his head rolled into a corner.

column2: Then the young man cried instead, 'Hop!

column2: I am here.'

column2: Being very cunning, however, he made no resistance, and rolled over as if he were as dead as the other men.
column3: Being very cunning, however, he made no resistance, and rolled over as if he were as dead as the other men.

column2: Still, the prince was no fool, and wondered if indeed he was as dead as he seemed to be; but the captain lay so stiff and stark, that at last he was taken in.
column3: Still, the prince was no fool, and wondered if indeed he was as dead as he seemed to be; but the captain lay so stiff and stark, that at last he was taken in.

column2: The prince went round all these and carefully locked them up, bidding his mother take care of the keys while he was hunting.
column3: The prince went round all these and carefully locked them up, bidding his mother take care of the keys while he was hunting.

column2: So the moment that her son had turned his back, she opened the doors of all the rooms, and peeped in, till she came to the one where the robbers lay.
column3: So the moment that her son had turned his back, she opened the doors of all the rooms, and peeped in, till she came to the one where the robbers lay.

column2: But if the sight of the blood on the ground turned her faint, the sight of the robber captain walking up and down was a greater shock still.
column3: But if the sight of the blood on the ground turned her faint, the sight of the robber captain walking up and down was a greater shock still.

column2: She quickly turned the key in the lock, and ran back to the chamber she had slept in.
column3: She quickly turned the key in the lock, and ran back to the chamber she had slept in.

column2: Soon after her son came in, bringing with him a large bear, which he had killed for supper.
column3: Soon after her son came in, bringing with him a large bear, which he had killed for supper.

column2: As there was enough food to last them for many days, the prince did not hunt the next morning, but, instead, began to explore the castle.
column3: As there was enough food to last them for many days, the prince did not hunt the next morning, but, instead, began to explore the castle.

column2: He found that a secret way led from it into the forest; and following the path, he reached another castle larger and more splendid than the one belonging to the robbers.
column3: He found that a secret way led from it into the forest; and following the path, he reached another castle larger and more splendid than the one belonging to the robbers.

column2: He knocked at the door with his fist, and said that he wanted to enter; but the giant, to whom the castle belonged, only answered: 'I know who you are.
column3: He knocked at the door with his fist, and said that he wanted to enter; but the giant, to whom the castle belonged, only answered: 'I know who you are.

column2: 'I am no robber,' answered the prince.
column3: 'I am no robber,' answered the prince.

column2: 'I am the son of a king, and I have killed all the band.
column3: 'I am the son of a king, and I have killed all the band.

column2: He waited a little, but the door remained shut as tightly as before. Then he just put his shoulder to it, and immediately the wood began to crack.
column3: He waited a little, but the door remained shut as tightly as before. Then he just put his shoulder to it, and immediately the wood began to crack.

column2: When the giant found that it was no use keeping it shut, he opened it, saying: 'I see you are a brave youth.
column3: When the giant found that it was no use keeping it shut, he opened it, saying: 'I see you are a brave youth.

column2: Let there be peace between us.'
column3: Let there be peace between us.'

column2: Now the queen led a dull life all alone in the castle, and to amuse herself she paid visits to the robber captain, who flattered her till at last she agreed to marry him.
column3: Now the queen led a dull life all alone in the castle, and to amuse herself she paid visits to the robber captain, who flattered her till at last she agreed to marry him.

column2: The robber, indeed, granted him his life, but took out both his eyes, which he thrust into the prince's hand, saying brutally:
column3: The robber, indeed, granted him his life, but took out both his eyes, which he thrust into the prince's hand, saying brutally:

column2: 'Here, you had better keep them!

column2: Weeping, the blind youth felt his way to the giant's house, and told him all the story.
column3: Weeping, the blind youth felt his way to the giant's house, and told him all the story.

column2: The prince drew them out of his pocket, and silently handed them to the giant, who washed them well, and then put them back in the prince's head.
column3: The prince drew them out of his pocket, and silently handed them to the giant, who washed them well, and then put them back in the prince's head.

column2: 'Tell the fox and the squirrel that they are to go with you, and fetch me back the prince's sword,' ordered he.
column3: 'Tell the fox and the squirrel that they are to go with you, and fetch me back the prince's sword,' ordered he.

column2: Directly they came to the window of the robber captain's room, the monkey sprang from the backs of the fox and the squirrel, and climbed in.
column3: Directly they came to the window of the robber captain's room, the monkey sprang from the backs of the fox and the squirrel, and climbed in.

column2: The room was empty, and the sword hanging from a nail.
column3: The room was empty, and the sword hanging from a nail.

column2: He took it down, and buckling it round his waist, as he had seen the prince do, swung himself down again, and mounting on the backs of his two companions, hastened to his master.
column3: He took it down, and buckling it round his waist, as he had seen the prince do, swung himself down again, and mounting on the backs of his two companions, hastened to his master.

column2: The giant bade him give the sword to the prince, who girded himself with it, and returned with all speed to the castle.
column3: The giant bade him give the sword to the prince, who girded himself with it, and returned with all speed to the castle.

column2: 'Come out, you rascal! come out, you villain!' cried he, 'and answer to me for the wrong you have done.
column3: 'Come out, you rascal! come out, you villain!' cried he, 'and answer to me for the wrong you have done.

column2: The noise he made brought the robber into the room.
column3: The noise he made brought the robber into the room.

column2: In his turn he fell on his knees to beg for mercy, but it was too late.
column3: In his turn he fell on his knees to beg for mercy, but it was too late.

column2: As he had done to the prince, so the prince did to him, and, blinded, he was thrust forth, and fell down a deep hole, where he is to this day.
column3: As he had done to the prince, so the prince did to him, and, blinded, he was thrust forth, and fell down a deep hole, where he is to this day.

column2: His mother the prince sent back to her father, and never would see her again.
column3: His mother the prince sent back to her father, and never would see her again.

column2: After this he returned to the giant, and said to him:
column3: After this he returned to the giant, and said to him:

column2: 'My friend, add one more kindness to those you have already heaped on me.
column3: 'My friend, add one more kindness to those you have already heaped on me.

column2: Give me your daughter as my wife.'
column3: Give me your daughter as my wife.'

column2: So they were married, and the wedding feast was so splendid that there was not a kingdom in the world that did not hear of it.
column3: So they were married, and the wedding feast was so splendid that there was not a kingdom in the world that did not hear of it.
